characters: MICHAEL'S HAND BREAKS THROUGH THE DRIVERS SIDE WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, run down farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cardboard skeleton nailed to the wall of a shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bed sheet in the form of a ghost. It's gently swaying  back and forth in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half finished barn. A tumbleweed blows by the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scarecrow with a pumpkin for a head. It sits on a  tractor, an axe by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fence. A sharp piece of farm equipment is hanging from  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Halloween style weathervane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ambulance appears in the distance, it's headlights  barely penetrating the wall of darkness. It's a large and lonely road, surrounded on either side by a thick wall of towering trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking in on the two PEOPLE in front. They're bot men in their thirties or forties. They don't talk to each other, just stare straight ahead. We see movement through the tiny window at the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance pulls up to the gate. The driver honks the  horn. A GUARD comes running out of a building. He turns o his flashlight, looks inside the ambulance, then at his  clipboard. He waves them through.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Okay.  Go on through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another GUARD pushes a button on a control panel and the  doors slide open. A MAN AND WOMAN rush in, wet.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: All metal objects into the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put the objects into the tray.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Purpose of visit?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: A patient pickup and transfer to Smith's Grove.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Should be on the road.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Yeah, ha, hell of a night huh?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Real charmer.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: I'll take you down there.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: All right.  The man and woman follow the attendant through hallways.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: First time here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hope it's the last.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You never get used to the faces.  Never.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Jesus ain't got nothing to do with this place. Come on.  They step into an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Yeah this is where society dumps its worst nightmares.   Yeah the one your picking up-just thinking about him give me the willies.  Yeah, a decade ago, Halloween night he  murdered 16 people, maybe more-trying to get to his siste Nearly got her too.  But his doctor, of all people, shot  him six times.  Then he set him on fire.  Both of them  nearly burned to death.  Yeah, I'll be glad to see this o gone. Oh yes in deedie.  He opens the elevator door.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Welcome to Hell. The scene switches to a person all bandaged up laying in hospital bed. A NURSE talks to DR. HOFFMAN.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Doctor? The transfer personal are here.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Smith's Grove?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Hoffman, Medical Administrator.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Has he been prepped?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Ready to go.  Who signs for him?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Outside.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (To woman)  Check him out.  The man and the Dr. Hoffman both leave the room while the woman goes to check out the patient. She feels for his  blood pressure and then his hand falls out from under the sheet.  The scene then goes to the Dr. and the man.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I'd assumed Dr. Loomis would be here.  Michael Myers was  his patient.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: If Loomis read memos he's be here. Fortunately his positi is more ceremonial then medical. My hope is that he's  either transfer, retire, or die.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: All right.  Lets move him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is being wheeled out to the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Watch it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I can safely say that Michael Myers is now in your hands.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well I guess your happy to see him go. They put Myers in and close the doors.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Night Doc.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Drive Carefully.  They drive off, leaving Hoffman standing there. He's glad Michael Meyers is finally away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman and man are talking, an unconscious Michael  Meyers between them.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Did Hoffman say anything about living relatives?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah A niece living in his home town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's hand. It slowly grips his blanket. The terror h awakened...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: And? She's too young to be his legal ward.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: So the state owns him? Great.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You know I still don't understand... Suddenly, Michael's hand shoots forward, grabbing his hea The woman screams as Michael repeatedly pushes the man's  head into a wall. Blood smears along the wall. The woman  sinks down onto the floor, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: No! Michael digs his finger deep into the man's skull, drawin blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMIE LLOYD, Laurie's nine year old daughter, sits on the couch, staring out the window. An ambulance sits outside. Jamie is very pretty with dark hair. SUNDAY, the family  dog, sits next to her. RACHEL, the Corruthers' only  daughter, comes into the living room. She's about 16, 17. Her blond hair falls around her shoulders. She sits down  next to Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Kido. It's four in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What is this? Four nights in a row?  You going for a reco here?  The seven year olds insomniacs hall of fame?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Do you love me Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, serious questions tonight.  Of course I love you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Like a sister?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie, sometimes it's...

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Like a real sister?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We're not real sisters Jamie, but that doesn't mean I lov you any less. Jamie looks out the window and sees that the ambulance is gone.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Sure it does.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know you miss your parents, its hasn't been that long.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: It's been eleven months.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Your mother used to baby-sit me when I was your age.  I b you didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Your lucky.  I wish she could do the same for me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Come on Jamie, lets go back to bed.  Come on Sunday.  She calls Sunday and he follows them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sleep tight.  We'll have French toast for breakfast, okay Come on Sunday. Night night.  She leaves, closing the door behind her. The window is  open, band wind blows inside, chilling the room. Jamie  walks over to close it, and as she does, she passes her  vanity, with a large mirror in the center surrounded by t mirrors on both sides. Thunder lights up the room, and  Michael, mask in place, is seen in the mirror. Jamie  doesn't notice.  Jamie closes the window and looks around. She walks to th closet and opens it. She sits on the floor and picks up a box. She takes off the lid and goes through the various  pictures inside. She comes to a picture and pulls it out. It's a picture of Laurie holding a pumpkin, smiling. Jami begins to cry. Thunder rumbles outside. Jamie puts the  picture back in the box and closes the closet door. She  walks over to her bed and gets on her knees, about to pra

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Now, I lay me down to sleep I pray the lord my soul to  keep, if I should die before I wake I pray the lord my so to take.  God bless Mr. and Mrs. Corruthers. God bless  Rachel, God Bless Sunday, god bless me. And god bless Mom and Daddy in heaven.  Amen.  She's about to crawl into bed when the closet door creaks open. Strange. Jamie slowly stands up and walks over to t closet. She grabs the door and opens it. On the floor is  her doll. She picks it up and sets it on a shelf. Jamie  turns, but a creak noise behind her grabs her attention.  She looks back into the closet, but of course nothing is  there. She stands for a minute, her mind in overdrive. Sh dismisses the noise and closes the door. She walks to her bed as thunder rumbles in the distance.  Again, the closet door creaks open. Jamie just stands  there. Why is the door opening? She slowly heads towards  the closet, her eyes roaming the room. Suddenly, a hand  snakes out from under the bed and grabs Jamie! She scream ans falls to the floor. Her tiny hands flail about on the floor, trying to find a handhold. She kicks and gets her  foot free. She races towards the door. At the bed, a figu sits up and turns to face us, even though he is bathed in darkness. Lighting cracks outside, and the room is  illuminated. It's Michael! Jamie screams and runs to her  door, but it won't open.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Help! Help me, please!  Michael stands up. He has a knife in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Help me! Somebody help me! She finally gets the door open, only to reveal... MICHAEL knife high in the air, prepared to strike. Jamie screams  and backs up in fear as Michael advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door flies open and DARLENE, Jamie's foster-mother, run out into the hall, closely followed by RICHARD, Jamie's  foster-father.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Jamie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlene flings the closet open to find Jamie, eyes closed clutching the box full of pictures. Darlene drops to her  knees and embraces Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Oh dear God. Its all right...a bad dream, just a nasty ol dream.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It's okay..it's okay.  Richard takes Jamie in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Your gonna be fine. Just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're house is a nice red brick with two stories. Looks to be early Victorian style. In the streets, children rid bikes and walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlene is making eggs. Richard bends down to pick up his coffee and his tie dips into it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Dammit, Darlene. Darlene looks over and sees his tie, wet. The phone rings

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Clean one in the laundry room next to your blue slacks.  (Picks up phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Honey, this tie has a spot on it, I can't wear this today I got a 10:30 with Chuck. Rachel comes into the kitchen and begins opening cabinets and pulling out stuff. She goes over to where Darlene is  talking.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (into phone)  Hang on Mrs. Pierce.  (to Richard)  Not that tie, on the other side.  (to Rachel)  That's not the only thing your eating Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm on a diet. You want an oinker for a daughter?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Found it.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: (into phone)  Sorry. Do you suppose Susan could just bring her crutches Oh, stupid question. Tell her I hope  she feels better.  (hangs up)  Susan's mother, she can't baby-sit tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Susan broke her ankle last night at the ice rink  (turns to Rachel)  Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mom, please

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: You'll have to watch Jamie tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Not tonight. I've got that date with Brady. You know how  important that is.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Well tonight is very important for your father and me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Can't you find somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Its too late.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to tell Brady? Sorry, but I've got to  baby-sit my foster sister, go and have fun by yourself.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Its not exactly the end of the world, for goodness sake Jamie appears in the doorway. Rachel doesn't notice her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sure it is. I think tonight Brady was ready to make a  commitment.  But now my future relationship, my engagemen my marriage, my children, your grandchildren, have all be wiped out because I have to baby sit tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I ruined everything. If I wasn't here you could go out.  She runs off. Rachel groans.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Good job Rachel. That little girl needs all the love we c give her right now and all you can do is think about  yourself. Rachel gets up and heads out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock at the door. It opens and Rachel comes  inside. Jamie sits on the bed, petting Sunday. Rachel sit down.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie, I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that. I can go ou with Brady tomorrow night. Its no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: But you wanted to go out tonight. It's my fault that you  can't.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well tonight we're going to do something better. We're  going to go trick-or-treating.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It's Halloween. I mean don't you want to get dresses up i a really scary costume and get some candy?  Jamie just sits there. Rachel has to try a different  tactic.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How about this afternoon I pick you up from school and we go get ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Double scoops?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (laughs) Double scoops. Now lets get some breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LOOMIS walks down the hallway, limping. He has burn  scars on his face and hand. He walks to a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoffman sits at his desk, typing.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Why wasn't I notified?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You know damn well about what.  You let them take it out here.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: For Christ sakes. Spare me the speech. I've listened to i for a decade.  The fact is that Michael Myers was a feder patient, and a federal prisoner therefore he is subject t federal law.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: We're not talking about any ordinary prisoner Hoffman! We are talking about evil on two legs.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I can see this is useless. Loomis Do you know what today is? Do you know the date? Everyday look at myself in the mirror and everyday I remember. Loo at me Hoffman, take a good look.  He holds up his hand and indicates his face.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I don't want to have anyone live through that night again

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I've said this before. I think your the one who needs  medical help. His phone rings. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, Dr. Hoffman...I see...I see...thank you.  He hangs up. He looks at Loomis, not sure how to say this

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Apparently there was an accident. Just south of Mill Cree near the... But Loomis isn't listening. He bolts to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Loomis! Loomis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Road flares are lit and tossed on the ground. Police tape is strung up. Loomis's car comes roaring down the road. I pulls up to the accident scene. An OFFICER waves them, on The car comes to a stop and Loomis and Dr. Hoffman climb  out.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Is that it?  He points to the overturned ambulance in the pond.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Yes.  A COP comes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Sometime in the night. They probably lost the road in the storm. Come down the embankment. It happens.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: An accident?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Do you believe that? He starts walking towards the pond. Dr. Hoffman can't  believe Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: How many people in the bus?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Four plus Myers.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: How many bodies did you find?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: It's hard to tell, there all chewed up.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Loomis, it's over. Leave it alone.  Loomis just stands there for a minute, then walks into th pond. The water is not very high, and Loomis uses his can for support. He walks to the back of the ambulance and  looks inside. Everything is bloody. The bed is tipped and splattered with blood. Loomis knows what happened. He  knows. Loomis turns away from the scene of bloody carnage and walks back to shore.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: He's gone. He was here, and he's gone. Dr. HOFFMAN Did you find any other bodies?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Not yet. There's a lot of ground to cover.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You won't find him. He's done all this. Now he's escaped. Dr. HOFFMAN You don't know that. Michael could have been thrown from  the bus.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: I've seen bodies thrown 50-60 feet from a crash site.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Look, even if by some miracle Michael is conscience, his  muscles would be totally useless.  Give the troopers a  chance to search.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Your talking about him as if he were a human being. That  part of him died years ago. He begins walking back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Now where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Haddonfield. It's a four hour drive. You can reach me  through the local police. If you didn't find him in four  hours, I'm sure I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MECHANIC works underneath a car. He calls out to anothe mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Hey, Gar! How about a 9/16 wrench over here?! He gets no response. He wipes off his hands with a rag an slides out from underneath the car. He gasps.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: stands above him, pole in hand. He smashes it into the  mechanic's stomach, killing him instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis's car pulls up to the gas station. Loomis turns th car off and gets outside. He yells out to the gas station

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey there! Hello?  No response. Loomis grabs the gas nozzle. He bends his  license plate back and unscrews the cap lid.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GARAGE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Someone is watching Loomis as he pumps gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes pumping the gas and places the nozzle back on the pump. He reaches into his coat for his wallet. He wal into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis searches through the garage.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? Is anybody here? Hello? Hello? Loomis passes a big hook, and suddenly there's a rattling behind him. He turns to see the mechanic, tied up with  chains, dead. Loomis races outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis races for the small store next to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis throws open the door and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Is anybody here?  No response. Loomis pulls out his small gun. He spots a  phone behind the counter. He races to it, but stops when sees the dead waitress laying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: God in heaven.  He looks at the phone, but it's broken. Loomis glances  around the store, and sees a pay phone on the back wall. walks over to it and grabs the phone. The cord has been  ripped out. Suddenly, he feels eyes on his back. He turns

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Michael?  And sure enough, there is Michael, wearing a pair of  coveralls, standing in the doorway to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Why now? You waited 10 years. I knew this day would come. Don't go to Haddonfield.  He takes a step closer to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: If you want another victim take me, but leave those peopl in peace. Please Michael...God Damn you... He raises the gun and fires two or three times before  realizing Michael is gone... He rushes to the window and  peers outside. He hears a car door slam close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis comes outside and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Michael?! Suddenly, the garage door breaks open as the towing truck comes roaring outside. Loomis takes aim and fires, but hi bullets do nothing to stop the truck. Loomis jumps out of the way. The truck hits one of the pumps, tossing it into the air. Fire erupts, engulfing the other pump, then  Loomis's car. A huge explosion ensues. Loomis jumps behin some barrels. The truck takes off down the road. The fire spreads to the electrical pole and blows the fuse box. Th wires snap free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings and all the children come pouring out. The all wear costumes, except Jamie. She goes over to a rack  and grabs her lunch box. Three KIDS surround her.

dialogues.speaker: BOY 1
dialogues.text: Hey Jamie! Where's your costume?

dialogues.speaker: BOY 2
dialogues.text: Where's your mask? Or are you wearing it?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I don't need to wear a stupid costume.

dialogues.speaker: BOY 1
dialogues.text: That's because everyday is Halloween at Jamie's house.  Right Jamie. Because your uncle is the bogeyman. The kids start chanting bogeyman.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: How come your mommy didn't make you a costume?

dialogues.speaker: BOY 2
dialogues.text: How could she? Her mommy's dead.

dialogues.speaker: BOY 1
dialogues.text: Jamie's Mommy's a mummy.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Stop it okay? Stop it She starts walking away. The kids begin chanting, "Jamie' an orphan."

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Stop it. Please Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie runs outside, but the kids' chants still haunt her. She runs over to a tree and begins crying. She immediatel stops. JAMIE. You're okay. You're okay.  A car pulls up. Rachel sticks her arm out and waves.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie!  Jamie turns. Rachel notices that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie, are you okay? Jamie gets in the car and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sits in between Rachel and her friend Lindsay.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You remember Lindsay don't you?

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: Hi Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You ready for some Ice Cream?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I wanna go trick-or-treating like the other kids.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But I thought you didn't want to go trick-or-treating.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: You know Rach, Discount Mart is having a sale on Hallowee costumes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. Brady's working there till 6:00 today.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: I know! Don't you want to talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't want to look pushy.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: You won't look pushy.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well I don't want to come on too strong. A guy hates a gi to come on strong. Fragile egos and all of that.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: You won't come on too strong.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well I don't want to seem desperate or anything.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: Fact it Rach, you are desperate. (silence) Your just goin to go in and buy a costume for Jamie. Perfectly legit.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: Well do I drop you off at the Discount Mart or the Dairy  Queen?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: The Discount Mart. Can we get Ice Cream after?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You bet.   They continue driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE, a teen around Rachel's age, tries on sunglasses,  looking into a mirror. But he's really staring at KELLY, beautiful blond teen with looks that could kill. The only problem is she's Sheriff Meeker's daughter. BRADY, Rachel boyfriend, and another GUY are by Wade. Brady stands behi a counter while the guy stands next to Wade.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Hey Wade, why don't you go ahead and make your move?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Don't rush me Brady. Timings got to be premo.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yeah well, money talks and bullshit walks. you know what mean?  He throws a wad of bills onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Double or nothing you don't ask Kelly out.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: All right, ten bucks. Lets see it.  Wade and the guy place their money on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: He's not gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Chicken.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Don't forget man, she's Sheriff Meeker's daughter

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Her Daddy don't scare me.  He makes his way over to Kelly, who is standing on a step stool, placing bottles onto a shelf. Wade coughs to get h attention. She turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Fuck off Wade. Wade turns to Brady and the guy, hurt. Kelly goes back to shelving bottles. Brady and the guy start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsay's car pulls up to the curb and stops. Rachel and  Jamie get out. Rachel calls to Lindsay.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Call me.

dialogues.speaker: LINDSAY
dialogues.text: Okay, bye. They go inside and Lindsay drives off. We see a familiar  tow truck sitting opposite the Discount Mart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady immediately spots Rachel and Jamie as they walk  inside.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Rachel! What are you doing here? I thought I was supposed to pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie needs a Halloween costume.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: You do? Okay. Go down aisle A. We've got the best costume in the whole town.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Come on Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: In a second.  Jamie heads for the costumes aisle while Rachel talks to  Brady.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Okay sure. What about?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Its about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jamie, wandering the aisles. There are all sorts of masks She passes by a white one. She looks through the racks an sees a clown costume.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Rachel, I found the perfect costume come see.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Rachel and Brady kissing. Rachel pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: My parents baby-sitter canceled.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So I have to watch Jamie tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: When did you find this out?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This morning.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Well you found out this morning? Why didn't you tell me  before? I mean it's 5 o'clock now Rachel...shit

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don't get angry.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I'm not angry it's just  Kelly looks over. A plan is forming in her head.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Can I come over after Jamie's asleep?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: My parents are going to come home early tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't know Brady.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Okay, I guess. I'll call you later.  He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jamie looks at herself in the mirror with the costume. On another aisle, a burned hand reaches down and grabs the  white mask. Jamie continues to look into the mirror, when suddenly her image changes to a little boy in a clown  costume holding a knife. She steps back in fear and bumps into Michael. He pulls on the white mask. He reaches out  for her and Jamie screams. She backs up into the mirror,  shattering it. Shards of glass go flying. Jamie sinks to  the ground. Rachel comes running over, and Michael is no  where to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: It was the nightmare man

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: He's coming to get me Rachel.  Kelly walks over.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Your okay. You probably saw a mask and it scared you. At  least your not cut. Come on, lets go home. Brady, Wade, and the Guy come over.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She'll be fine. They get up and leave. Nobody notices Michael's reflectio in a broken piece of glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis walks down the road, beat. His throat is parched a his feet are tired, but he marches on. A station wagon  speeds down the road, and Loomis tries to flag it down, b it speeds past him. A car speeds past him, then stops. It full of CHEERLEADERS and a GUY

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Come on old man! Loomis begins hobbling towards the car while the  cheerleaders shout at him to hurry. As he gets closer, th car takes off, making dust fly into the air. We can hear  the people laughing. Loomis stands in the road, rejected. Suddenly, there's a honk behind him. He turns to see a  truck, PETE SAYER at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: SAYER
dialogues.text: Get in here old man. Loomis walks over to the truck and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very old, beat up truck. Sayer is an old, eccentric man living in his own fantasy land.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything for a fellow pilgrim. Sometimes we need help  getting where we want to be. (sneezes) Reverend Jackson  Pete Sayer of Dumon County, please to make your aquanauts

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: How far are you going, Mr. Sayer?

dialogues.speaker: SAYER
dialogues.text: Gods Country, Promise Land. Where are you heading Mr..ah

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Loomis. Haddonfield.

dialogues.speaker: SAYER
dialogues.text: Car trouble?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: SAYER
dialogues.text: Your hunting it, ain't ya? Yeah, your hunting it all righ just like me.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: What are you hunting, Mr. Sayer?

dialogues.speaker: SAYER
dialogues.text: Apocalypse, end of the world, Armageddon. Its always got face and a name.  He takes a drink of the liquor. Hunting the bastard for 30 years give or take. Come close time or two. Too damn close. You can't kill damnation Mr. it don't die like a man dies.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I know that Mr. Sayer.

dialogues.speaker: SAYER
dialogues.text: Oh your a pilgrim all right. I saw it on your face back  there in the dust. I saw it clear as Breasts and blue sue shoes. Would you like a drink? (Hands Loomis the bottle w takes it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Halloween night, and the children are out. But not a are collecting treats. A few KIDS throw toilet paper over tree, then run away laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Darlene are at the front door, getting ready leave. Jamie is in the kitchen scraping off a plate.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay Jamie, we're leaving. Where's Rach?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I don't know. Rachel comes into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Here I am.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Come on, hon. He takes Jamie's hand and leads her into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: How do we look?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You guys always look great.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: We'll be at the Fallbrooks. The number's next to the phon

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know, and next to that is the police, hospital, fire, a probably National Guard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I want you two to have fun tonight. Make sure Jamie's in  bed by 9:30. Rachel opens the door and her parents step outside.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BUSHES
dialogues.text: Richard and Darlene are at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're gonna be late. You don't want to blow your  promotion.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Don't make fun. Tonight is the difference between vacatio in Bermuda, or spending another two weeks in Cleveland wi your grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good luck, Dad.  They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie turns to Rachel, barely containing her excitement.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Rachel, can I go get my costume on?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, hurry up.  Jamie hurries upstairs. Rachel makes sure she's upstairs, then walks into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDOW
dialogues.text: Rachel walks into the living room. The POV walks past the brick wall to the other window. Rachel is sitting in a  chair, phone to her head.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is Brady there? (pause) He's not back from work yet? (pause) Okay...Well when he comes in could you tell him to drop b at about eight. I should be home by then. (pause) This is Rachel. Okay, bye.  Rachel hangs up, depressed. She calls up to Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Come on Jamie, your gonna miss all the good Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sits on her bed, clown costume on. She pulls on the small face mask, which looks like a dorkier version's of  Robin's mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel gets up off the chair and moves out of our line of site.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Come on Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jamie come running down the steps. She opens the  front door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Come on Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Coming.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I thought you said you were ready.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'm ready. I'm ready. Okay, let's go. They leave the house, Jamie excited. Rachel closes the  door. And off they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's making his way upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The box full of pictures has been thrown down, all the  pictures scattered. A burnt hand comes into view, and  starts going through the pictures. They are pictures of  Laurie and Jamie at an earlier age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis comes in.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Ah, I need to speak with Sheriff Bracket. HANK, the cop on duty, turns from his desk.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Well then, you'll have to travel about 3 thousand miles  south of here.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Bracket retired in '81. Went to St. Petersburg

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, who's the new Sheriff? BEN MEEKER, the new sheriff of Haddonfield, walks over to Loomis. He's a man in his early forties with an air of  power. Not a man whom who should cross.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I am. Ben Meeker.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Oh, Sheriff Meeker, my name is Dr. ...

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Loomis. Folks around here aren't likely to forget your  face. At least not cops. So what brings you back here aft 10 years?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Michael Myers has escaped from Ridgemont. He's here in  Haddonfield.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: That's impossible. Michael Myers is an invalid.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: He's here, Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: 10 years ago he tried to kill Laurie Strode, and now he  wants her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Are you talking about Jamie Lloyd?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Where ever she is, that little girl is in mortal danger.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Myers has been locked up since before she was born. He's  never laid eyes on her.  He turns his back, and starts to move off.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Six bodies, Sheriff! That's what I have seen between here and Ridgemont. A filling station in flames. I'm telling y Michael Myers is here in this town. He's here to kill tha little girl and anybody that gets in his way.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Hank, call the troopers and check his story out.  (to Loomis )  And assuming what you say is true..

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Its true, Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Its true, what the hell can we do t avoid a repeat of what happened 10 years ago?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Find this little girl, get her somewhere safe. Call the  local T.V. station. Tell them to get people off the stree and behind locked doors.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Can't get long distance, Sheriff. Operator says the lines are down.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: All right, lets go.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: When he makes that call.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: All right. Pierce, do it. Lets check on this little girl. He and Loomis leave the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie is at a house, getting candy.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Thanks!  She takes off to the next house. Rachel can hardly keep u

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie, wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: This is great Rachel. Come on.  She takes off for the next house. Rachel is less than  enthused. She slowly makes her way to the next house, a m of kids running past her. Jamie is already at the next  house. She knocks on the door. A WOMAN answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Trick-or-treat.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: My what a cute little clown. Lets see what I have for you There you are, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You're welcome. They get back on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Had enough?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: No way! Halloween's great. Can we stay out all night?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Forget it kido. We're home by eight o'clock.  They cross the street and meet a group of four kids, one whom is the boy who teased Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: Look, there's Jamie. Jamie and Rachel stop.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: That clown costume is really cool.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: KID 2
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nobody notices Michael, standing across the street, hidde in the shadows of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: Hey wanna go with us? Jamie looks to Rachel for permission.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Go ahead. The kids run to another house. It's a brick house with tw stories, an attic, and a basement. The kids ring the  doorbell. The door opens to reveal Kelly Meeker, wearing long T-shirt that says, "Good cops do it by the book." Sh sees Rachel and glances back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Hi Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi. Kelly starts to give the kids candy, a big smile on her  face. Rachel glances back into the house and sees Brady  come down the stairs. Rachel can't believe it. As the kid start to leave, Rachel turns in disgust and follows. Brad comes racing out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Rachel! Rachel! Kelly stops him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Just a second. He races off after Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Rachel, I've got an expl-- I've got an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don't owe me anything. Jamie walks on with the rest of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Hey Jamie come with us.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Okay! Jamie follows the other kids, leaving Rachel and Brady to argue.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Just leave me alone and lets forget it.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: No, you don't understand.  He glances over at Kelly standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I mean, you blew off our date at last minute.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So you hop on to the next best thing? I thought you were  different from other guys.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: I am different, it's just that I just got pissed  off...that's all.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh really? Well, I'll just let you get back to little Ms. Hot panties.  She starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Rachel! But Rachel doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie!  Brady puts his hands behind his head and watches Rachel g He messed up big time.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Brady, are you coming in or what? Brady takes one more glance at Rachel then goes back  inside. Rachel looks around for Jamie, but doesn't see he or the kids she was with.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie! Jamie! Great Rachel, just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very noisy bar, just like any other. A T.V. positioned  behind the bar is turned on.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: By order of the Sheriff's office, all citizens of  Haddonfield are asked to clear the streets. EARL, the store's proprietor, watches the news.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Everybody shut up a goddamn minute. Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: All businesses are asked to close as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: What's all that shot about, Earl?  Earl picks up a phone and starts dialing the police stati

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Not like 'ol Ben Meeker do something like that.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Sure ain't. Martians could land on Ben's doorstep, all he do is spit once and get himself a shot gun.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Who you calling?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Police station. I ain't closing down with out a good  goddamn reason.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 2
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: It just rang.  He hangs up and takes a swig of a beer. Then he's off. He looks at the others.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Well, come on. Jackie, watch the register for me, hun.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You got it Earl. As Earl and the other men leave, all the other people in  the bar stop what they are doing and follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl and the other pile out of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: What's going down?

dialogues.speaker: GUY 2
dialogues.text: Where are we going Earl?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: We're going to Ben's. The phone never just rings at a  police station.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: No way. No how.

dialogues.speaker: GUY 2
dialogues.text: Wake up the Sheriff. They all get in their trucks and rive off. A hillbilly mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Meeker comes in, holding a shotgun.  Loomis is right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Loomis steps inside. He tries the ligh switch. Nothing. Loomis isn't surprised. He looks around. That's when he spots the pictures on the ground. He bends down and picks them up. As he does this, he notices  something even worse. Meeker comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Something?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: He's been here.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: How do you know?  Loomis looks at the closet. Meeker follows his gaze. In t closet is Sunday, dead.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: This is starting to spook me.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Least I'm not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker and Loomis come down the stairs. LOGAN, a deputy  with blond hair in his late thirties, stands in the livin room.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Logan, I want you to stay here in case the family gets  back.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Right here, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: You look sharp. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No problem, Sheriff. Loomis and Meeker leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUCKY, an electrician, opens a fuse box. He tries a fuse  switches. Nothing. He pops a piece of gum in his mouth. H glances up, and sees Michael, standing behind his truck.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Hey you! This is city property. No trespassing. He walks over to Michael, who just stands there, bathed i darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: What are you, deaf? Don't try that Halloween shit with me All right, I'm on the telephone to the police right now.  Don't you even think about leaving.  He turns and begins to walk towards the phone. Michael  begins following. Bucky turns and Michael grabs his shirt and belt, and throws him through the air. Bucky lands on power unit, and sparks fly. The whole place buzzes while  Bucky screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky continues to fry, while sparks shoot up into the ai Michael turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flicker, then go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge explosion rips the beams, and then all is quiet.  Poor Bucky is fried to a crisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are still trick-or-treating, but their parents  drive up in cars and collect them. The kids complain, but the parents are very firm. Meanwhile, Rachel wanders the streets. She stops in the  middle of a street.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie! No response. Rachel begins walking.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BROKEN WINDOW
dialogues.text: He is breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie is lost and alone, scared. She is in the bad part o town, and has no one to go to. Suddenly, a noise behind  her. She turns around. A bush is moving. But is it the  wind, or something far more sinister?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Rachel? Is that you? Is that you? Jamie turns away, very frightened. She starts walking.  Behind her, on a porch, is a grinning jack-o-lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is also scared, but trying not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie? Jamie! She stops walking, and hears a branch snap behind her. Sh glances behind her. She sighs and starts walking again.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie? She looks past a house into an alley. It's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie? Rachel sighs. She could be anywhere. Rachel glances the  other way and sees a dirt road. But that's not what  attracts her attention. It's the man that does. His upper body is shrouded in smoke. He begins walking towards  Rachel. She backs away and runs down the alley. She jumps onto the tire and grabs a hold of the fence. She begins t climb it, going as fast as she can. When she reaches the  top she jumps down to the ground, and takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh God! She runs down an alley and jumps over a small fence  separating two lawns. She runs onto the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (scared) Jamie. She takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie walks down a dark street. She hears rustling behind her. She turns around and looks behind her at all the tre and the old house.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Whoever you are, I have a really big dog with me and he  bites. In the background, Rachel comes running across a lawn.  Jamie turns and sees Rachel. Rachel rushes over to Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie! Where have you been? Don't ever go off on your own at night again okay? Not ever.  They hug, both glad for the company. Suddenly, headlights illuminate them. They look over to see a cop car. Meeker  and Loomis get out.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Rachel, Jamie. Thank God!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Get in the car. Come on, quick. Rachel and Jamie hurry to the car and get in the back.  Meeker makes his way over to the driver's side. Loomis is about to get in when he sees HIM. Michael, standing acros the street, hidden behind a row of bushes. Meeker spots h too.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Is that him? Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Yes. Across the street behind Meeker another Michael appears.  Meeker turns and spots him. Then a third Michael appears.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. Doc...

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Dear God.  Loomis pulls out his gun. Which Michael is real. He takes aim and is about to fire when:

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Hey! Don't shoot! The other two also pull of their masks, and run away,  laughing and taunting.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Get home dammit. There's a curfew. If I catch your asses, it'll be a weekend in jail. You all right Doc? Come on,  we'll get to the station and get these kids safe. In the car, Jamie begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay. Meeker and Loomis get in the car and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: (on CB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in Pierce. Behind them stands the real Michael Myers, watching,  waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole place has been wrecked. papers and equipment ha been strewn about. Meeker and Loomis survey the  destruction.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. They wouldn't have given up without a fight.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: They didn't know what they were fighting. Meeker makes his way deeper into the station. He stops wh he spots Hank, stabbed and cut in so many places. He can' believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: How can a man do this Loomis? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It isn't a man.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: What is he? Tell me! What the hell are we dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Evil. With that, Loomis exits the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Jamie are still in the car, Jamie sleeping. Th three trucks full of hill billies drive up, and Jamie wak up. Meeker and Loomis come out of the police station as t hillbillies pile out of the trucks.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: What in Sam Hill is going on?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Go on home Earl. It's police business.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: What the hell did this?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Looks to me like your out of business. Now I want some  answers.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I haven't got the time or the patience to argue with you. Now go home to your families where you belong.  The men start talking and cause a big commotion. Loomis  decides to end it.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It was Michael Myers. He's come home to kill.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Let it be Earl. Let the police handle it.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Like the last time? How many people killed back then? How many kids?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Al here lost his boy 10 years back.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Well not this time, Ben. I'll handle this my own way. We' gonna fry his ass.  The others agree and head for the trucks. Meeker turns on Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch, you just created a lynch mob.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You haven't got a police force! These men may be the only defense you've got. The men get in their trucks and drive off. Meeker watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: God help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan runs out of the house, closing the door behind him. He runs to his car and climbs inside. He grabs his CB.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: 132 to 133 this is 134.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: This is 132, over.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Ben-uh-I just heard about the station. The camera pans back to show Michael's burned hand  clutching the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Go to my house. We'll call the state force from there.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'll be there in 5 minutes.  He starts the car and pulls out of the driveway. As his c speeds down the road, the Corruthers' car enters their  driveway. Darlene gets out, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Honey, I don't think their home.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How do you know their not?

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Because the lights are all out.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I told them to be here by nine. Its not 9:30 yet.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: We should call the fire department.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I'm not calling the fire department. They run inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl's truck goes down the road. The hillbillies search.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: There he is...I've seen his face right there Al, in those bushes. They all climb out of the truck and take aim at some  bushes. The bushes move and all the hillbillies open fire For what seems like hours the hillbillies shoot, until  they're positive he's dead. They rush over to the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Shit, Earl. It's Ted Holster.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You dumb son of a bitch, you said you saw Myers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Brady are on the floor, making out. Brady slide Kelly's shirt up to reveal her panties. They're kissing  passionately.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Lets go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: No, I think we're doing just fine here.  Kelly takes off her shirt, revealing her bra.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Oh, I think I'm in Heaven.  Kelly giggles. Brady takes off his shirt. Kelly slowly  reaches behind her back and begins to remove it. She does it slowly, coyly. She slides one strap off, then the othe She hides her breasts and leans down, and Brady's hands a all over her. Suddenly, headlights appear on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: It's my dad!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Your dad? Your dad!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop car pulls in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Brady are hastily getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: God, if he catches us like this he's going to skin you  alive for starters.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: What? Kelly grabs her bra and stuffs it underneath a couch  cushion.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome have piled out of the car and are headed  towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Where's that Deputy?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Be here in a minute. They go inside. A few seconds later, Logan pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady sits down in a chair. Kelly tosses him a magazine. pretends to read it. Meeker and the others come inside.  Rachel sees Brady and knows exactly what happened.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Rachel, take your sister upstairs. First door on the righ

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Dad, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Kelly, I want you to close and lock all the downstairs  windows.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Where's the radio?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Right through the kitchen you'll see the basement stairs. (to Brady)  Brady, you know how to use a gun?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Meeker goes to the gun cabinet, and pulls out a shot gun, hands it to Brady.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Think you can handle that?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, you want to tell me what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, when I have time.  Logan comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: You got your riot gun?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah in the trunk of my squad.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Go get it.  He grabs a box full of bullets and hands them to Brady.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Take these.  He then gives Brady the toolbox.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Okay, you got a hammer and roofing nails. I want you up i the attic securing it so that nobody can get in.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: You know, if something's happening, I should just go call my parents.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Just get up in the attic.  As Brady turns to go up to the attic, Meeker stops him.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I catch you groping my daughter I'll use that sh gun on you. You understand? Brady nods and heads for the stairs, more than a little  scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan walks out to his car. He sees that the one of the  back seat doors is open. He closes it, only a little  worried. He goes to his trunk and opens it. He pulls out  his riot gun and closes the trunk. He heads for the house

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Get the outside shutters.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Making sure that no one can get in here.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Isn't this all a little paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: If you'd seen that police station you wouldn't even ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady stops at the doorway and looks in at Rachel and  Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Are you two okay?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We've been better.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Michael Myers.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: 10 years ago? Halloween? He's Jamie's uncle.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: The kids at school were right.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Um, I'm gonna be outside, upstairs in the attic. Logan is out fixing the shutters and Brady goes into the  attic.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: That's all the windows, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: All right. Good Good.  Logan I want you right here by the front door. This is the dead bolt key.  He locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Now I pad locked the back door, this is the only way in a out of this house. You got that?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Got it Ben. He turns to Kelly, who's just standing there.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Why don't you go make some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady is nailing a window shut. Suddenly, he hits his  finger with a hammer.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Oh shit!  He hears a noise coming from some dark corner of the atti

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Hello?...Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie and Rachel lay on the bed, trying to go to sleep. B after all they've been through, it might be a while befor either of them get a good nights rest.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Can we go home soon Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Real soon, Jamie. Now shh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis and Meeker walk over to the radio. Meeker sits dow in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: How's it powered?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Batteries. I planned the generator for the house next wee I wished I hadn't waited.  (into radio)  This is squawk 79er zero of Haddonfield broadcasting on t state police emergency frequency. Can anyone hear me?  He gets nothing but static, so he switches frequencies.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Can anyone here me?  (Static)  Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sits in the rocking chair, shotgun in his hands. He slowly rocks back and forth. Kelly is in the kitchen maki coffee. Rachel comes down the stairs and walks over to  Logan.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie's sleeping. When can we go home?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: State police will get here soon. Not long after that. Don worry.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: It won't be long. Myers face appears in the next room. You can barely see i but Logan senses its presence and turns to look. But  Michael has already disappeared from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis and Meeker are listening to the radio, trying to  contact help.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I hear someone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is Frank Bute over in Tuckerville you got some kind emergency?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. This is Ben Meeker. Sheriff over in Haddonfiel Our phone and power lines are down and we have a killer  running lose in the street. Michael Myers.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of Halloween prank?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: This is no joke. We need those troopers and we need them  now.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: All right. I'll get those troopers right away, hang on I' need some information.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere Mr. Bute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis comes up the stairs. He meets Rachel, who is just  entering the living room. He inquires about Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Rachel, is your sister all right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She's fine.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Good.  (to Logan)  Sheriff's radioed for help. they'll be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Hell of a night.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Its not over yet.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: The Corruther's house. That's where Jamie lives, that's  where he'll go.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Leave Myers for the state boys.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: The state police won't know how to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Maybe nobody knows how to stop him, but I've got to try. Loomis leaves to go find Michael. Logan closes and locks  the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel goes into the kitchen and Kelly is searching for  something. She's checking all the cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Are you looking for this?  She hands Kelly a pack of sugar. Kelly takes it and goes  over to the coffee. Kelly seems sad. She tries to patch  things up between her and Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I didn't know you and Brady had anything okay?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You knew. You just didn't care.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: He's not married. Besides, I've got a right to do what's  best for me.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Don't you mean what you do best?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Wise up to what men want Rachel, or Brady won't be the la man you lose to another woman. Rachel picks up a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: RACHAEL
dialogues.text: Have some coffee.  She pours it all over Kelly's shirt. Kelly gasps, surpris at Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker is listening to the radio. It suddenly comes alive with the hillbillies.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Over at Alan gateways, shot Ted Holster by mistake.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 2
dialogues.text: Well is he dead.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. Rachel comes down the stairs and stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: 04'd out there, this is Ben Meeker...Answer me dammit.  All he gets is static. Nobody out there wants to take  responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sheriff, what is going on out there?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: All right Rachel, you stay by this radio. The state boys  will send word once their in route. When that word comes  you go tell deputy Logan.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Now you understand?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Meeker heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker walks over to the door. Logan stands up. Meeker ge the key and starts unlocking the door.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I'll be out on gateway and I doubt I'll be back before th troopers get here.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you ought to wait here till they do.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Hey. I got a town full of beer bellies running around in  the dark with shotguns. Who's gonna be next? Somebody's  wife? Somebody's kid?  He cocks his gun.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I can't stand by for that. He opens the door and leaves. Logan closes the door,  worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie sits up in bed. She looks around, but doesn't see  Rachel. She gets worried.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is listening to the radio. She hears a creak behin her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs Kelly is done making coffee and brings it in to  Logan.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I thought you might like some coffee.  He continues to rock.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Pretty boring out here. I wish they'd fix the power.  She sets the coffee down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Least we'd have some MTV while we wait for the calvary. She picks up some matches and lights one. Carefully, so n to extinguish the flame, she lights the candle. And she  screams. Logan's dead body is in the corner, blood  splattered on his face. Kelly turns to the man in the  chair. He stands up and turns to her. It's MICHAEL! He slowly advances for her. Kelly screams and backs up.  Michael brings the shotgun back and rams it right through Kelly, lifting her up and ramming her against the wall. T shotgun enters the wall, pinning Kelly's lifeless body  against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel is listening to the radio. It suddenly crackles an Frank Bute comes on.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Haddonfield, we should have cars dispatched in 5 minutes. ETA 35 minutes, Over.  Rachel grabs the mike and brings it up to her face.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ah, okay, great. We'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Ah ten-four over.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ah, over and out. Rachel puts the mike down and heads for the stairs. She  looks behind her one last time to make sure Frank doesn't decide to speak again. Then she goes up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks around. Logan's rocking chair is empty. She  isn't bothered by this and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Deputy Logan?  When she receives no reply, Rachel's happy demeanor  evaporates.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Deputy?  She looks around and sees Deputy Logan's bloodied corpse the table. She turns and sees Kelly's lifeless corpse  dangling from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhh!!!!! She heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie!!! Jamie!! She starts up the stairs but trips. She quickly gets up a sprints the rest of the way up. She reaches the door to t bedroom and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh God! Oh God! Rachel goes hysterical. She runs down the stairs and bump into Brady.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on? Rachel starts back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I've gotta find Jamie. Brady grabs her and starts pulling her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: No, no, we have to get out of here right now.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Not without Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Look.  He point to Logan's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: You think she stands a chance?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: She's not dead! Brady rushes over to the door and tries to open it. But  it's locked and the key is nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Is there another key?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don't know! Brady rushes over to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Get out of the way, get out of the way.  He raises the shotgun and shoots the door twice. He rushe over to the door. He touches the knob but pulls it away  quickly. He goes back over to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Its metal, god dammit its metal.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: We're trapped in this house. They start up the stairs. Rachel looks up and sees Jamie  come out of a door.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Oh Rachel!  Rachael runs up the stairs to Jamie and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Rachel! Rachel releases Jamie and runs to the stairs. She looks  down. Michael is in the living room, standing behind the  fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Get back!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: No. You son of a bitch! Brady aims the gun at Michael, who is slowly walking up t steps. He pulls the trigger. Nothing happens. No bullet  comes out.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady! Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Get up there Rachel!  Brady fumbles with the bullets, not able to get them in t shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Shit! Michael continues climbing the stairs, with each step  getting closer...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Get up there Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady! Come with us! Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Go! Brady has one bullet in, he tries to hurriedly put in  another.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Brady!

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Go!  Brady puts the bullet in and snaps the chamber closed. He turns to aim, but Michael is already upon him. Michael  grabs Brady by the shoulders. Brady fires, but the shot  goes wide and hits the wall. Michael throws Brady against the wall. He hits hard and slumps down. Jamie tries to pu Rachel away.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Rachel come on.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Come on.  Brady looks up at Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: BRADY
dialogues.text: Shit. He grabs the shotgun and stands up. He hits Michael on th head with the butt of the gun. He swings again but Michae grabs the gun. They struggle for a second before Michael  slams it into Brady's face. Brady falls back onto the  floor. Michael tosses the gun over the railing. It lands  with a thud on the living room floor.  Brady stands up and walks over to Michael. His nose is  bleeding. He rears back his hand and punches Michael righ in the face. Brady pulls back his arm and takes another  swing, but Michael grabs it. He pulls back and we hear  bones crunching. Brady screams in agony. With his other  hand, Michael grabs Brady's throat and starts to lift him off the floor...  Michael releases Brady's hand and wraps his other hand  around Brady's throat. Brady tries to spit in Michael's  face, but he misses and it lands off to the side. Michael starts pushing his finger into Brady's cheek. Brady screa in agony. Michael's finger digs deeper into Brady's cheek We hear a crunching sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Jamie stop at the platform to the attic. Rache looks back and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Leave us alone, just leave us alone.   They run up the rest of the stairs. Rachel looks around a sees a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie! Rachel throws the suitcase onto the platform. Jamie grabs something and throws it down too. They continue picking u items and throwing them onto the platform until it's  cluttered with junk. Rachel grabs Jamie and moves her  farther into the attic. Michael reaches the platform, but he's blocked by all the junk. Jamie lets out a small gasp when she hears Michael. Rache looks around. She starts pushing Jamie in a certain  direction.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Michael is starting to clear a path through all the stuff in his way...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on! Michael has cleared a path and starts walking up the very few steps that are left... Rachel and Jamie come to a window, but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Rachel!  Michael stops for a second. He notices a tin can full of  knives. He grabs the biggest, sharpest one and continues  toward Jamie and Rachel...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Jamie, get down. Get down.  Rachel grabs a suitcase and uses it to smash out the  window. She throws the suitcase out onto the roof and ben down.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Get on my back Jamie. Get on, hold on. Jamie climbs onto Rachel's back. Very carefully, Rachel  steps out of the window and onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks down and sees how far she is to the ground. they fall and hit the pavement, they're dead. She grabs  onto a pipe jutting up from the roof and uses it to pulls herself up.
